text: Paul Samuel "Pops" Whiteman (March 28, 1890 â€“ December 29, 1967) was an American bandleader, composer, orchestral director, and violist. He was known as the "King of Jazz". His most popular recordings include "Whispering", "Valencia", "Three O'Clock in the Morning", "In a Little Spanish Town", and "Parade of the Wooden Soldiers". ==References== Category:1890 births Category:1967 deaths Category:American jazz musicians Category:American pop musicians Category:American composers Category:American violinists Category:American bandleaders Category:Musicians from Denver Category:Writers from Denver Category:Deaths from myocardial infarction
title: Paul Whiteman
